select count(*) from ( select t.id_card from t_screening_list t where valid = 1 and doctor_id = #{doctorId}
and t.abi_status = 1 and t.vpt_status = 1
and t.vpt_status = 2 and (t.abi_status = 0 or t.abi_status = 1)
and t.abi_status = 2 and (t.vpt_status = 0 or t.vpt_status = 1)
and t.abi_status = 2 and t.vpt_status = 2
and (t.abi_status = 2 or t.vpt_status = 2)
group by t.id_card ) q
select count(t.sid) from t_foot_result t where t.assess_code = #{assessCode} and valid = 1 and doctor_id = #{doctorId}
select t.assess_value ,count(t.sid) count from t_foot_result t where t.assess_code = #{assessCode} and valid = 1 and t.doctor_id = #{doctorId} group by t.assess_value

select sid, id_card, item_code, item_value, insert_dt, update_dt, valid, member_id, doctor_id from t_screening_stats where valid = 1 and member_id = #{memberId} and doctor_id = #{doctorId} and item_code = #{itemCode} limit 1
select t.item_value ,count(t.sid) count from t_screening_stats t where t.item_code = #{itemCode} and t.doctor_id = #{doctorId} and valid = 1 group by t.item_value
